lexUnit.name: comfort.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to feel less unhappy; console.

sentence.text: To watch women comfort each other can be a deeply moving experience which rolls back centuries of shared experience of the burden of living .
But she bore the pain stoically , trying to comfort herself with the thought that Luke was unaccustomed to failure with women .
With a brave shudder Nelly poured the water on the tea leaves , comforting herself with the thought that boiling water killed germs of all sorts .
He comforted himself that his wife , being foreign , had just repeated the phrase parrot-fashion and did n't mean by it what he would have meant .
We can comfort ourselves in the knowledge that death must have supervened very quickly .
Therefore , there is no magical procedure that will comfort all people during the period that follows loss .
They like to watch a tough woman up there on the screen and comfort themselves with the thought that they 'll never have to live with her . "
Joe always aided and comforted me when he could , in some way of his own , and he always did so at dinner-time by giving me gravy , if there were any .
They are unlikely to be embarrassed or contemptuous ; it is a natural human instinct to want to comfort someone who is obviously unhappy .
But when it comes to the middle of the night , most of them prefer to leave it to mum to comfort the tiny tot when he 's having a tantrum .
My job was to say a few words that might comfort both groups .
She opened them when Pascoe leaned across , anxious to comfort her .
During those first terrible days when he wept , she held him to her and comforted him .
So she stayed with him , on the dark landing , holding his shivering little body and trying to comfort him .
But we did not create much poetry : we held each other tenderly , and he comforted me with kisses .
Any normal man would comfort someone in her situation .
Having told her story with some brio , Miss Breeze burst into tears and was comforted by the motherly Miss Maitland .
Surely we should not be comforted by the thought that others are worse off !
His widow Jane was said to be ` inconsolable " as she was being comforted by friends .
Isabelle was being comforted by family and friends last night after an anonymous call from England confirmed the awful truth to her .
New users will also be comforted by an on-line tutorial , a workbook manual full of step-by-step lessons and a set of keyboard templates .
She 's being comforted by friends .
The father of murdered Catholic Sean Hughes is comforted by friends after finding his son shot dead
He died before reaching hospital and last night his mother was being comforted by relatives at her Princes Road home .
Tug felt his hectic heartbeat slow down and his pulse grow calm , as if he were a little child being comforted after a nightmare .
She sounded like a tired child , needing to be comforted .
When she goes home she cries and can not be comforted .
Louis wept openly and could not be comforted .
But presumably men were comforted in the same way , so why are they , unlike women , unable to pass it on ?
You can feed the hungry and comfort the oppressed and visit the sick and bury the dead .
Who comforted him now , she wondered , if he awoke in the night in pain ?
All those below were too busy and had not time to spare to comfort him with a few minutes ' companionship .
His wife Gill was being comforted last night by family and friends .
How do you comfort the person to whom you have done an injury , particularly if you reject the idea that your behaviour carried any cause for reproach ?
Mr Cameron Gibson , the local minister , comforted a steady stream of relatives all day .
